alert.note: Alert for Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Apopka, Winter Park, Maitland, Wedgefield, Azalea Park, Goldenrod, Conway, College Park, Avalon Park, Lockhart, Pine Hills, Bithlo, Belle Isle, Orlando Executive Airport, Union Park, Fairview Shores, Orlovista, Edgewood and Eatonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
